column6: G / g -> Latin,گـ / ـگـ / ـگ -> Arabic,
P / p -> Latin,پـ / ـپـ / ـپ -> Arabic,
È / è (ie) -> Latin,ݔـ / ـݔـ / ـے -> Arabic,
J / j -> Latin,جـ / ـجـ / ـج -> Arabic,
Š / š (sh) -> Latin,شـ / ـشـ / ـش -> Arabic,

column4: Like ĝhaen in Perso-Arabic script.,Used for loanwords and in eastern dialects: ghair (others), ghali (carpet), ghaza (noise)

column6: H / h -> Latin,هـ / ـهـ / ـہ -> Arabic,
S / s -> Latin,سـ / ـسـ / ـس -> Arabic,
K / k -> Latin,کـ / ـکـ / ـک -> Arabic,
L / l -> Latin,لـ / ـلـ / ـل -> Arabic,

column4: Exclusively used for loanwords (like in the English words: service, very).

column6: B / b -> Latin,بـ / ـبـ / ـب -> Arabic,
I / i (í) -> Latin,ایـ / ـیـ / ـی -> Arabic,

column4: Is the same as Ř / ř (ře) so this latter is preferably used to simplify the orthography.
Sounds like the "oo" in English word "root".

column6: Ť / ť (th) -> Latin,ٹـ / ـٹـ / ـٹ,ࢣ -> Arabic,

column4: Only used for loanwords: Fráns (France), fármaysí (pharmacy).

column6: N / n -> Latin,نـ / ـنـ / ـن -> Arabic,
T / t -> Latin,تـ / ـتـ / ـت -> Arabic,
C / c (ch) -> Latin,چـ / ـچـ / ـچ -> Arabic,
M / m -> Latin,مـ / ـمـ / ـم -> Arabic,
